DOC.detailed_description: Male female DoD beneficiary age 18 year old diagnose Type II diabetes , recruit Mike O'Callaghan Federal Medical Center ( MOFMC ) . Screening Visit : - Obtain sign Informed Consent Document HIPAA Authorization ( research-driven ) . - Record : Date birth , phone number , age , gender , race , ethnicity , social security number , current email address , height ( inch ) , weight ( pound ) , blood pressure , medication list include over-the-counter prescription weight loss medication ( name , strength , dose ) supplement . - Subjects follow standard care blood test drawn include : - Hemoglobin A1c via 1 venipuncture ( 5-10 ml , approximately 1-2 teaspoon blood drawn ) Visit 1 ( Day 1 within 1 week Screening Visit ) : - Record : Weight ( pound ) , blood pressure , change medication list . - Subjects complete RAND 36 Item Health Survey . - Subjects complete Intake Questionnaire . - Subjects assign Fitness Tracker username username password record Research Coordinator . - Subjects give User Instructions base randomization group . - Subjects instruct follow research procedure failure may result removal study return Fitness Tracker . - Subjects randomize research coordinator use random-number generator one two group ( research-driven ) : - Group 1 : use fitness tracker able see participant 's data . - Group 2 : use fitness tracker able see member 's daily weekly result . - Both group receive script feedback set time interval Research Coordinators . - Subjects provide fitness tracker instruct use . - If subject DoD beneficiary , finish study-related procedure month 6 , keep fitness tracker . If subject complete study-related procedure , ask return fitness tracker investigator erase data re-issue another study subject . - If subject active duty DoD employee , regardless study completion , ask complete Temporary Issue Receipt bring back fitness tracker end study . Visit 2 ( Month 3/90 day post Visit 1 ) : - Record : Weight ( pound ) , blood pressure change medication list . - Subjects complete RAND 36 Item Health Survey . - Subjects complete Follow Questionnaire . - Obtain information fitness tracker . - Subjects follow standard care blood test drawn include : - Hemoglobin A1c via 1 venipuncture ( 5-10 ml , approximately 1-2 teaspoon blood drawn ) Final Visit 3 ( Month 6/90 day post Visit 2 ) : - Record : Weight ( pound ) , blood pressure change medication list . - Subjects complete RAND 36 Item Health Survey ask additional question . - Subjects complete Follow Questionnaire . - Obtain information fitness tracker . - Subjects follow standard care blood test drawn include : - Hemoglobin A1c via 1 venipuncture ( 5-10 ml , approximately 1-2 teaspoon blood drawn )
DOC.criteria: YOU MUST BE ABLE TO GET CARE AT NELLIS AFB ( A MILITARY INSTALLATION ) IN ORDER TO PARTICIPATE IN THIS STUDY . Inclusion : Male female DoD beneficiary , age 18 year old , diagnose Type II Diabetes Ability set fitness tracking software personal computer cell phone Ability learn use personal activity monitor Exclusion : Male female DoD beneficiary , age 18 year Unwilling share personal fitness result anonymously Inability 4 metabolic equivalent exercise ( walk 100feet , walk flight stair etc ) . Inability walk without use assistive device ( cane OK ) Medical problem would make walk unsafe ( recent surgery , uncontrolled heart condition , fall risk etc ) . No special population ( e.g. , pregnant woman , child , prisoner , detainee ) recruit .
